alert.note: Alert for Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Crook County through 300 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Warren Peak, or 11 miles northwest of Sundance, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Devils Tower Junction around 245 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Devils Tower National Monument. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.
